samples.question: What do you think?
samples.transcript: I think if they live there for a long time, it is fine. But, well, I could see that some people, not all of them, but some people are rude to old people. And then if they meet in the subway or like in the traffic, I do not see they are respecting the people. So because of that, I think that is the only reason that I think they should not live in the, city area. But other than that, if they lived there for a long time, I think it does not matter. Okay, good.
samples.transcript_original: Um, I think if they live there for a long time, it's fine. But, well, I could see that some people, not all of them, but some people are rude to old people. And then if they meet in the subway or like in the traffic, I don't see they are respecting the people. So because of that, I think that's the only reason that I think they shouldn't live in the, um, city area. But other than that, if they lived there for a long time, I think it doesn't matter. Okay, good.

And then if they meet in the subway or like in the traffic, I do not see they are respecting the people. So because of that, I think that is the only reason that I think they should not live in the, city area. But other than that, if they lived there for a long time, I think it does not matter.

samples.question: Do you think it is possible that all of the population would move to cities sometime in the future?
samples.transcript: I think they are already moving to cities. I have a friend who live in the countryside area and then farm, and I think it is really important for them to do that, but, yeah. I think it can be possible for them to move to cities because it is not really convenient for them to live there. I think, I personally think. You know, because when I travel to, like, countryside, if you do not have a car, you cannot move because the buses come so late. And, yeah, the traffic is not really good. I think that is the most important thing that I think. True. Yeah. And one more question.
samples.transcript_original: Um, I think they are already moving to cities. I have a friend who live in the countryside area and then farm, and I think it's really important for them to do that, but, yeah. samples.question: Insoo, are you working or are you a student?
samples.transcript: I am working right now. I am working as a freelancer. I teach like young children and also young adults English and also about communication.

samples.question: And do you like your job?
samples.transcript: Yeah, part much I like teaching because I think it is a really meaningful thing for me to do as a living It also gives me a life-giving meaning by just teaching because I am thinking that I could learn from like anybody, anything. Nice.

samples.question: My hometown?
samples.transcript: I am like right now living in a place called 중랑구. it is in Seoul, which is our capital city. And it is a kind of a bed town. We do not have much things to do, but still I like my hometown. that is about my hometown. And now we are going to talk about being bored.

samples.question: So, do you often feel bored?
samples.transcript: Yes, I think I feel bored a lot. So, that is why I do a lot of, like, activities because I do not really like the feeling about being bored.

samples.question: Okay, so, when do you feel bored?

samples.question: And do you think childhood is boring or adulthood is boring?

I think that time is very bored because they have a duty to do to study. okay. And now we are going to talk about celebrities.

samples.question: So yeah, your question is, could you describe a time when some people near you made a lot of noise?
samples.transcript: The time when some people near me made a lot of noise is when I was in the like loud subway. We were using the public transport, transportation. And there, the subway was very crowded so there were a lot of people. And my friends, my friend was making a short call with her boyfriend and her voice got louder and louder because of the crowded people like the loud noises that the people made. So that time was when she made a lot of noise. So like I felt a bit frustrated about her loud voice because I think people should be, like need etiquettes in the public transportation. So I wanted her to be quiet so I asked her to lower her voice but still she was a bit like excited by calling her boyfriend. So she did not lower her voice. So that made me a lot of like frustrated and also it gave me a bit of like anxiety. So that time was when my nearest person made a lot of noise. That thing first came in my mind. Okay, so that was one minute 15 total. Okay.
samples.transcript_original: Um, the time when some people near me made a lot of noise is when I was in the like loud subway. We were using the public transport, transportation. samples.question: Noise-free?

So they could scream and like yell to each other by a fun way. So I think that place is the most noise-free place for me.

samples.question: And how do people usually react if other people are making excessive noise?
samples.transcript: The first thing is that I think people ignore it because in our country it is very important to respect other people's opinions. So I think the first one will be ignoring it, but the second one should be asking them to be quiet because, yeah, that would be a bit of communication that people could do.

samples.question: Yeah, and do you think most people can do that effectively?

samples.question: And why cannot people make noise in libraries or museums?
samples.transcript: I think it is because that the libraries and museums should be a place where people have to focus on a specific thing. Like in the library, they should focus on their books that they want to borrow. And in the museum, there should be some like art, art or like those things that are in the museums. So people should focus on there. So if people become loud in that place, they are disrupting other people. So that would be a rude thing.
samples.transcript_original: Hmm. Um, I think it's because that um, the libraries and museums should be a place where people have to focus on a specific thing. samples.question: The first question, what kind of places should be noise-free?
samples.transcript: Noise-free means like there should be no noise. Yeah. You know, you might say like this is a smoke-free zone or alcohol-free zone where you cannot do that. Oh yeah, I was a bit like, I got a misunderstanding because I thought that word was like, kids free. So yeah, that is the same thing. No kids zone. Yeah, no kids zone. that is a very common thing in our country. Right, right, right. Anyway, that is all good. So you answered the rest of them very well. So yeah, that was just that. yeah, there is a few grammars that I will just point out to you. Nothing too major. maybe one time I asked you about your opinion about childhood and adulthood. You said like, I will guess that, neither, neither of them are boring. Instead of I will guess, I think it is better to say like, I would say, I would say, or in my opinion, or I believe, yeah, instead of guessing. there was one time when you are talking about a time that was very, you said that time is very bored. So make sure it is ING in that situation. Like maybe high school is boring. Like students feel bored. Yeah. So I think you know yourself anyway, but ED is your feeling or a person's feeling and ING is describing the situation. So that time is really boring for them. Yeah. one thing about countable, uncountable is news instead of news are true, the news is true. Yeah, you could say news stories there, so those news stories are true, but if you are just saying news in general it should be is.

samples.question: And do you like your name?
samples.transcript: I think I like my name. My grandfather gave it to me. there were, there were some, like, candidates for my names. But one of them was same as previous, president of Korea. So my grandfather disagreed. So he said, Min-Suk is better than the, the other one. So he gave me this name. Okay.
